Author: BitHubHQ
Title: [ANN][EXCHANGE] BitHub – Digital Asset Exchange [New York]
Body: There're a lot of features that we're working on. EMA, SMA, Parabolic SAR, MACD, Stoch RSI + various notification tools (i.e. RSI goes below 30, etc.) We need funds to be able to get more resources to implement it all.  There are also a few long-long-term ambitious ideas from our founder, but I wouldn't want to talk about them yet, since they're at the concept stage now and aren't part of a roadmap.

Many of the participants of the forum asking you for information but you don't give a ... Who are the developers ? photo ?  This is the most popular question. We're currently working with our lawyers to get our profiles published. We'll have to postpone the ICO.

Author: BeBlockTech
Title: [ANN][EXCHANGE] BitHub – Digital Asset Exchange [New York]
Body: I don't mean to be an a*s but;  -The fact that you come here with a project without sharing your team members -The fact that the name on the website is not the same as the name of your project -The fact that you are not clear about with whom you are working: Banks, VC or whatever -The fact that you've built your website 5 days ago (Jan 03)  And as last; -The fact that you only paid for 3 months SSL certificate while it's less expensive to take it for one year or more...  https://imgur.com/a/BtoeS  All this together makes me really believe that your project is just another scam. We are not stupid over here you know. A newbie account that comes and tries to sell us fake promises is really not going to work. You registered 1 month before your announcement and you are expecting from us that we give you our hard earned money?  So my question is very simple: Would you put your own money into such a project? I don't think so.  I don't know who you are, but it's people like you who are giving crypto such a reputation, and the only thing I can think about when I come across such projects is that the founders of it belong in a cell. Have some self-respect dude.

Author: BitHubHQ
Title: [ANN][EXCHANGE] BitHub – Digital Asset Exchange [New York]
Body: Let me go one by one.  -The fact that you come here with a project without sharing your team members We have a security token. Current regulations are pretty unclear as for the personal liabilities. We are working with our lawyers to get this one properly figured.  -The fact that the name on the website is not the same as the name of your project BitHubHQ means BitHub Headquarter. Adding HQ suffix is a common technique in the startup world. Example: https://slackhq.com/, https://highrisehq.com/  -The fact that you are not clear about with whom you are working: Banks, VC or whatever Please, re-read the thread. We are not working with Banks. We are also not working with VCs. We have our own team with engineers working at banks in the past.  -The fact that you've built your website 5 days ago (Jan 03) This is obviously wrong. The website went live at the end of November. Feel free to check the announcement on our social accounts.  -The fact that you only paid for 3 months SSL certificate while it's less expensive to take it for one year or more... We paid 0 for the SSL certificate. This is called LetsEncrypt. Free certificates sponsored by Google, Mozilla, Cicsco, etc. Feel free to check our website on 4/3/2018. Its certificate will automatically gets renewed for 3 more months. In fact, nobody buys Godaddy, RapidSSL, Comodo, etc. certificates anymore.  Our bitcointalk account was indeed registered one month ago. We had to make an announcement and we registered an account. It's not a crazy science.  As I said, we're currently working with our lawyers to get our team members profiles shared with the community. We're also going to make a few interesting announcements later this/next week.

Author: BitHubHQ
Title: [ANN][EXCHANGE] BitHub – Digital Asset Exchange [New York]
Body: We've moved to BITHUB.COM.  The decision has been made to skip the ICO and fund the entire project with our own capital.  Our pre-launch campaign is LIVE. We have a referral program with rewards:  "Secrets of Trading" E-Book Free 1 mBTC One Year of Zero Fee Transactions Access to Premium Trading Tools

Author: BitHubHQ
Title: [ANN][EXCHANGE] BitHub – Digital Asset Exchange [New York]
Body: Dear Bitcointalk Members!  We're excited to announce BitHub, a Cryptocurrency Exchange headquartered in New York.  We built a best-in-class digital asset exchange from the ground up to put the safety and security of your assets first. BitHub is a fully compliant and transparent digital asset platform.  https://www.bithubhq.com   → Buy BHT and get a discount. Pre-sale starts in February/March.  → Invite a friend who buys $100 of BHT or more, and you'll earn 10$ of free BitHub token. Sign up to get your unique referral link at bithubhq.com once the Pre-Sale is live.  → Whitepaper  Why BitHub?   1. Profit Sharing 20% of all revenue generated by BitHub is automatically paid out to token holders, in amounts based on each holder's share of the total amount of tokens.  2. Low Fees BitHub's maker-taker fee schedule offers fee discounts as well as rebates for high-volume market participants. We also process all deposits and withdrawals free of charge.  3. Institution-Grade Security BitHub adheres to CryptoCurrency Security Standard (CCSS). All U.S. Dollar deposits are held at FDIC-insured banks. The majority of digital assets are stored offline.  4. Superior Client Services Client service specialists are available around-the-clock to assist you with any inquiries and answer questions about our unique offerings.  5. And much more...  - Professional trading features  - Wallet management  - FIX, WebSocket, REST APIs  - Online trading courses  - Tools to create automated trading bots  Technologies We Use  Scala Kafka Kubernetes Google Cloud Platform ReactJS Redux and others...  Resources  Whitepaper: Download (v1.0) Website: https://www.bithubhq.com Bounties Thread: TBD  Community  Twitter: https://twitter.com/BitHubHQ Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BitHubHQ Telegram: https://t.me/BitHubHQ  Cheers, BitHub Team

Author: BitHubHQ
Title: [ANN][EXCHANGE] BitHub – Digital Asset Exchange [New York]
Body: We do understand that sharing the core team members is important and we'll be able to do so very soon. In fact, it will happen during the ICO campaign.

Author: BitHubHQ
Title: [ANN][EXCHANGE] BitHub – Digital Asset Exchange [New York]
Body: We are not working with any of those companies. Our team members worked there in the past. We're also not interested in selling anyone's data.  Our goal is to build an exchange with features for professional traders (Stop Trailing Orders, RSI, MACD, StochRSI, etc.). We also deeply care about user interface and user experience. Today, there is only one real exchange on the market – GDAX. As for all the other exchanges, we believe that they are way too confusing, ugly and slow. But even GDAX lacks an enormous number of features. BitHub is going to fill the gap between professional trading and beautiful user experience.

You also have no working demo or anything at all other than a simple whitepaper, seems your too early for an ICO if your even a real company.

Author: Konablacksand
Title: [ANN][EXCHANGE] BitHub – Digital Asset Exchange [New York]
Body: The fact that 1) They dont list the team members for us to research them; 2) They state that the members are all part of the Fed Reserve Cronies (goldman SUX, Deutsche bank, surely their are rothchilds and JPMorgan cronies as well!) 3) The fact they are creating an exchange that appears to be an entity backed by big banks and wall st indicate to me that it will be used to attempt to control crypto prices thru the utilization of naked short contracts like that of the CME and CBOE where no physical coins will be delivered and all contracts will be settled in FIAT.  This SMELLS LIKE A RAT, LOOKS LIKE A RAT and WALKS LIKE A RAT. I hope this one crashes and burns. I WILL NEVER SUPPORT OR CONDUCT ANY BUSINESS ON AN EXCHANGE HEADED BY BIG BANKS AND FED RESERVE CRONIES!

Author: BitHubHQ
Title: [ANN][EXCHANGE] BitHub – Digital Asset Exchange [New York]
Body: @Konablacksand I'm sorry, this is our mistake that we didn't make it clear enough. Our ENGINEERS worked at Goldman Sachs, Deutsche Bank, AOL, etc. We are totally not backed by Wall St and those fancy corporations/enterprises. Feel free to mail to hello@bithubhq.com and we can schedule a phone call.
